1027328.name: Knitted Mask Holders
1027328.notes_html:
Pattern has 2 options. Without or with opening for ponytail.
Materials

Yarn: DK approx. 12-13 yards/6g
Debbie Bliss Cotton DK Tension 20 stitches and 28 rows =4in square/10cm
Needles: US 6 (4mm) straight or circular. Holder is worked flat
Tapestry needle
Two 1-inch buttons
Abbreviations K-knit, kfb-knit into front and back of stitch, K2tog-knit 2 stitches together, ssk-slip, slip, knit.

1028395.name: Cat Face Mask Mate
1028395.gauge_description: 18 stitches and 10 rows = 4 inches in double crochet
1028395.notes_html: This mask mate ear saver utilizes button eyes for attaching the elastic strap of a face mask. Can be made with other weights of yarn by using appropriately-sized crochet hook - just keep in mind that the finished size will vary based on your choices.

users.about_me:
I have been obsessed with crafting since before I could walk. My Mom and Grandma used to graciously give me supplies, which I would turn into my masterpieces. Over the years, I have experimented with all types of mediums, though I always seem to come back to fiber arts.
I've designed patterns for years, but they were written in my version of shorthand that only I could follow. Now I am updating those patterns and writing new ones to share my love of knitting and crochet with other crafters.
Come check out my blog to see all my creative tutorials and patterns.

1030435.name: Helferlein
1030435.notes_html:
This little helper is supposed to make wearing a face mask more comfortable. Especially when you have to wear the mask for hours at work, it relieves the sensitive skin behind the ears.
All you need is a small leftover (approx. 3 g / 11.5 m) “sport weight” yarn, 2 nice buttons and half an hour of time.
I have improved 2 errors in the instructions, but unfortunately it does not show an update in the library (at least for me). It is best to delete the pattern from your library and add it again. Please make sure that you download version V_3!

Dieses kleine Helferlein soll euch die Maskenpflicht ein wenig versüßen. Gerade wenn man die Maske auch bei der Arbeit über Stunden tragen muss, entlastet es die empfindliche Haut hinter den Ohren.
Man braucht dafür nur einen kleinen Rest (ca. 3 g /11,5 m) “sport weight” Garn, 2 schöne Knöpfe und ein halbes Stündchen Zeit.
Ich habe 2 Fehler in der Anleitung verbessert, aber leider zeigt es in der library (zumindest bei mir) kein Update an. Am besten löscht ihr das Muster aus eurer library und fügt es neu dazu. Bitte achtet darauf dass Ihr Version V_3 herunterladet!

pattern_author.name: Bea John
pattern_author.notes:
Ich stricke seit meinem 7. Lebensjahr, am liebsten Socken und "Zwei-Mann-Zelte". 
Immer öfter lasse ich fertige Anleitungen links liegen und stricke nach eigenen Ideen. Diese möchte ich hier gerne mit Euch teilen und freue mich, wenn Ihr Lust habt, sie selbst zu stricken.

Ich wünsche Euch viel Spaß dabei!
Bea

1030731.name: Button Less Mask Mate
1030731.notes_html:
Use this mask mate to tie back the elastic face masks behind your head.

If you can’t find enough buttons, use this Button Less Mask Mate using 10g - 15g of yarn.

Perfect for any leftovers, hold fingering weight
double, or use DK, Worsted - easily adjustable to any yarn and needle that gives a good I cord.

Make one in less than 30 minutes, and have fun playing with colours!

Please contact me directly at deborah@yarnindulgences.com if you have any questions. Happy knitting. xo

PS. CROCHET version coming in the next few days!

1032725.name: RainBOW Mask Mate Ear Saver
1032725.notes_html:
Designed to look cute and save your ears while wearing a face mask, this RainBOW mask mate will brighten your days!
You need less than 10 yards each of red, orange, yellow, green, blue, purple, and white.
Since the RainBOW does not need to be a specific size, checking gauge is not critical. Each rainbow circle is approximately 3.25” in diameter. The finished bow when flat measures about 9” from tip of buttonhole to tip of buttonhole. When folded, the bow is approximately 4.25” long.

1032735.name: Ear Saver
1032735.gauge_description: 3 stitches and 2 rows = 1 inch in double crochet
1032735.notes_html:
Ear Savers are great for people wearing masks for extended periods of time, have sensitive skin, or wear glasses and need to take added pressure off their ears. Simply put the Ear Saver across the back of your head and wrap the mask’s elastic band around each button.

Each Ear Saver uses between 8-10 yards (9 meters) of worsted weight yarn. I recommend using 100% acrylic yarn and plastic buttons so that it is washer/dryer safe. Recommended button size is either 3/4” or 1” (19 or 25 mm).

you can use either an H or an I hook depending on your level of comfort and tension
1032735.notes:

Each Ear Saver uses between 8-10 yards (9 meters) of worsted weight yarn. I recommend using 100% acrylic yarn and plastic buttons so that it is washer/dryer safe. Recommended button size is either 3/4" or 1" (19 or 25 mm).

you can use either an H or an I hook depending on your level of comfort and tension

users.about_me:
****Please note****
Due to my history of Epilepsy, I can no longer access Ravelry for updates, to answer emails or to offer pattern or forum support. I have since removed my patterns for sale from the platform and all patterns can now be found through my website, Etsy, Payhip or LoveCrafts. 
If you have any questions, feel free to message me at contact@fiercehook.com


My original profession was in the New York fashion industry for almost 10 years. Being fashion forward and on the cutting edge of style are the favorite parts of the designs I choose to create. I love to crochet and knit anything funky with a contemporary classic twist.

1034159.name: Double Strap Ear Saver
1034159.notes_html:
I’ve had trouble with ear savers sliding down the back of my head, which causes my face mask to shift and the mask straps to pull at the tops of my ears, rendering the ear saver pointless. I needed a knitted ear saver with two straps to keep my mask firmly in place.

The length can easily be customized to fit any size, but because not all masks (or head sizes for that matter) are made the same, I highly encourage you to test this on your mask to ensure the proper tension and fit.
1034159.notes:

The length can easily be customized to fit any size, but because not all masks (or head sizes for that matter) are made the same, I highly encourage you to test this on your mask to ensure the proper tension and fit.

users.about_me: There have been so many more projects I wish I could account for.  I have knit and crocheted blankets galore as well (my first crochet project was a granny square blanket for my little brother who was yet to be born when I was 10).  But everything else I've made has either been given away to people or thrown away after a flood ruined all of my belongings in storage (which was everything I owned but 2 suitcases worth of necessities, which luckily included a few of my knit projects).

1034554.name: One Button Ear Saver
1034554.notes_html: Crocheted ear savers have become a very popular useful item because of Covid 19. People everywhere around the world are wearing masks for protection of themselves and others. One main concern with wearing a mask for a length of time is the elastic becomes very trying on the wearer’s ears. Quickly patterns for a two button ear saver were introduced, which wore wonderfully, however now crocheters everywhere are having a hard time finding buttons. I decided to try and makeup a pattern that only needed one button. Voila a pattern evolved in my head and after many attempts and size variations I wrote a pattern.

1035367.name: Mask Ear Saver
1035367.notes_html:
Create a mask ear saver for our front line key workers, or just for yourself for when you’re out and about wearing your mask.

I used Yarn and Colors cotton (Must have minis) in order for the fabric to be quite robust. DK can be used, however it will stretch a lot more.

In addition to the yarn, you will need:-

  • 2 buttons
  • Yarn needle

1036511.name: Easy Ear Saver Mask Extenders
1036511.notes_html:
Easy to knit Ear Saver Mask Extenders to help those who wear masks for long periods of time.

Requires:
DK cotton yarn
3.5mm needles
2 buttons

These can be made with any DK yarn - but to make them easy to launder I used cotton yarn and acrylic buttons.

There are instructions for 3 sizes

To get this free pattern please click on the https link just below

1036833.name: Ear Saver - Mask Mate
1036833.notes_html:
I have created my first pattern. Ever!

This came out of necessity and helping a local group standardize Ear Savers among the crochet volunteers.

Don’t let the shape intimidate you. If you can create Half-Double Crochet stitches, Slip stitches, and you know how to chain, you’ve got what it takes to make these!

There are 3 size options because not all heads are created equal. Also, any yarn is usable that gets you the correct sizing. It’s also best to make them in a yarn that can withstand repeated washes with hot water as they may be sterilized (as best they can in a washer/dryer)
1036833.notes:

1040925.name: Shell ear saver
1040925.notes_html:
This is a mask extender/ear saver.
The finished size.is around 5 in. I used scrap cotton for mine. I also used cotton blend and both work well.
You will need to know how to do foundationless half double crochet. In the pattern you will use HDC and slip stitch. You will need two buttons, and needle for sewing buttons and weaving in your ends.

1051038.name: Ear Saver Laces
1051038.notes_html:
Wearing a mask all day to protect from coronavirus transmission can be hard on your ears. Give them a break by converting your elastic mask to a tie-on mask. A pair of these laces attaches to any mask (reusable or disposable) and ties behind the head to save your ears.

Laces are long enough to tie in a bow behind the head. (The crochet texture keeps the bow from coming undone during an 8-hour workday). If you need the laces longer or shorter, change the number of chains used for the lace.

This pattern is good for using up scraps. And, you don’t need any buttons!

The pattern is available as a PDF on https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GgBiymjClHD2N6YymL0dpm7Y.... I apologize, I’m having trouble adding it to the library as this is my first ever pattern.

Help fight COVID by making mask-wearing as easy as possible!
1051038.notes:
Wearing a mask all day to protect from coronavirus transmission can be hard on your ears.  Give them a break by converting your elastic mask to a tie-on mask.  A pair of these laces attaches to any mask (reusable or disposable) and ties behind the head to save your ears.

Laces are long enough to tie in a bow behind the head.  (The crochet texture keeps the bow from coming undone during an 8-hour workday).  If you need the laces longer or shorter, change the number of chains used for the lace.

This pattern is good for using up scraps.  And, you don't need any buttons!  

The pattern is available as a PDF on https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GgBiymjClHD2N6YymL0dpm7YPIgUYfBE/view?usp=sharing.  I apologize, I'm having trouble adding it to the library as this is my first ever pattern.

Help fight COVID by making mask-wearing as easy as possible!

1051536.name: 'You're a Star' Ear Saver
1051536.notes_html:
The pattern is available for free on my blog!

These allow you to attach mask straps to these buttons rather than your ears, making it much more comfortable to wear.

You can keep the ear saver plain, or add the appliqué to the middle for extra style! I was initially aiming for a flower, but it ended up looking more like a star, so I went with that.

This ear saver pattern is suitable for beginners and measures 95mm x 25mm. You can adjust the length by changing the number of chains your start with.

This pattern only uses a very small amount of yarn so is perfect for using up your leftovers

1259623.gauge_pattern: stockinette in the round (fingering weight gauge); 7.5 stitches per inch in stockinette in the round (DK gauge)
1259623.name: Peapod Marble Fidget Toy
1259623.gauge_description: 8 stitches  = 1 inch in stockinette in the round (fingering weight gauge); 7.5 stitches per inch in stockinette in the round (DK gauge)
1259623.notes_html:
Backpack charms and handheld fidget toys are all the rage for my elementary school-aged son and his friends. This knit design combines both! It is a knitted tube of varied width with an enclosed glass marble. Simple icord trim creates a loop to attach the piece to a backpack clip or to place around a finger and hold the toy. The use of a glass marble within soft yarn creates a silent toy that is sure to please students and teachers alike. Experiment with different colors and yarns to reflect your student’s personal style.

YARN
Knit Picks Stroll Fingering Tonal, 75% Superwash Merino, 25% Nylon, 462 yd / 422 m per 100 g or similar fingering weight yarn
Knit Picks Swish DK, 100% Superwash Merino, 123 yd / 112 m per 50 g, or similar DK weight yarn
www.knitpicks.com

Each backpack charm uses less than 10 g of either fingering or DK weight yarn.

FINGERING WEIGHT GAUGE
8 stitches & 12 rounds = 1” (2.5 cm) in stockinette in the round

DK WEIGHT GAUGE
7.5 stitches & 9 rounds = 1” (2.5 cm) in stockinette in the round

SIZE
Fingering (DK)
1” (1.25”) wide at widest point x 5” (6”) long / 2.5 (3.2) cm wide at widest point x 12.7 cm (15) cm long

The samples shown have 1 loop and 3 ‘pods’ for the marble to move through. Customize as you desire!

NEEDLES & TOOLS
Fingering weight: US 1 (2.25 mm) needles in preferred length for small circumference knitting, or size needed to get gauge
DK weight: US 2 (2.75 mm) needles in preferred length for small circumference knitting, or size needed to get gauge
Spare needle in same size as working needle
Scissors
Tapestry needle
1 locking stitch marker
1 standard glass marble for each toy, 0.5” / 13 mm diameter.
(A decorative glass craft bead or flat-bottomed glass drops may be used in lieu of a marble.)
1 small carabiner to attach to open loop, such as this, available through many hardware stores:
https://niteize.com/s-biner-stainless-steel-dual-carabiner

Tech editing: Bronwyn Hahn
Test knitting: Tammy B., Kim C., Lynne L., Tina P., Linda S., & Pam S.
1259623.notes:
Backpack charms and handheld fidget toys are all the rage for my elementary school-aged son and his friends. This knit design combines both! It is a knitted tube of varied width with an enclosed glass marble. Simple icord trim creates a loop to attach the piece to a backpack clip or to place around a finger and hold the toy. The use of a glass marble within soft yarn creates a silent toy that is sure to please students and teachers alike. Experiment with different colors and yarns to reflect your student’s personal style.

**YARN**
Knit Picks Stroll Fingering Tonal, 75% Superwash Merino, 25% Nylon, 462 yd / 422 m per 100 g or similar fingering weight yarn
Knit Picks Swish DK, 100% Superwash Merino, 123 yd / 112 m per 50 g, or similar DK weight yarn
[www.knitpicks.com][1]

Each backpack charm uses less than 10 g of either fingering or DK weight yarn.

**FINGERING WEIGHT GAUGE**
8 stitches & 12 rounds = 1” (2.5 cm) in stockinette in the round

**DK WEIGHT GAUGE**
7.5 stitches & 9 rounds = 1” (2.5 cm) in stockinette in the round

**SIZE**
Fingering (DK)
1” (1.25”) wide at widest point x 5” (6”) long / 2.5 (3.2) cm wide at widest point x 12.7 cm (15) cm long

The samples shown have 1 loop and 3 ‘pods’ for the marble to move through. Customize as you desire!

**NEEDLES & TOOLS**
Fingering weight: US 1 (2.25 mm) needles in preferred length for small circumference knitting, or size needed to get gauge
DK weight: US 2 (2.75 mm) needles in preferred length for small circumference knitting, or size needed to get gauge
Spare needle in same size as working needle
Scissors
Tapestry needle
1 locking stitch marker
1 standard glass marble for each toy, 0.5” / 13 mm diameter.
(A decorative glass craft bead or flat-bottomed glass drops may be used in lieu of a marble.)
1 small carabiner to attach to open loop, such as this, available through many hardware stores:
[https://niteize.com/s-biner-stainless-steel-dual-carabiner][2]

Tech editing: Bronwyn Hahn
Test knitting: Tammy B., Kim C., Lynne L., Tina P., Linda S., & Pam S.


  [1]: www.knitpicks.com
  [2]: https://niteize.com/s-biner-stainless-steel-dual-carabiner

packs.yarn_name: Knit Picks Stroll Fingering Solids, Heathers, Tonals & Twists

pattern_author.name: Shana S. Cohen
pattern_author.notes:
**ABOUT ME:**
I am an architect with experience teaching technical and design studio courses in several higher education venues. I bring my experience of geometry and writing design syllabi to my pattern writing, and my love of connecting with people to my teaching opportunities. My size-inclusive patterns are mostly modular designs, and mostly garter stitch! In pattern writing, I make legible directions that allow the knitter to customize their own work in the process. I pay attention to maximizing yardage and adaptability of styling in my work. In teaching, I love connecting with each student and helping to work through personal goals. Throughout all of my endeavors, I love connecting with individuals, helping them to become the best version of themselves. I aim to write my patterns in a way to foster this creative expression in you, the knitter. I hope you have fun playing with color and style when working my patterns and taking my classes.

**MY VALUES:**
I value individual expression within my fiber arts community. I recognize the privilege I hold as a straight-sized white woman in this space. I strive to elevate makers of all size, race, religion, gender and abilities and showcase work with fibers in a variety of price points, both from a variety of independent dyers as well as commercially available products.

I practice Jewish values of clean speech and *tzedakah* (charitable giving) within my design work and beyond in my personal life. My words and actions are my own and I work to spread peace and mindful language to those around me.

I believe in science and research and trust experts. I place a high importance on mental health, and focus on practices that support my personal mental health, and the mental well-being of those around me. My identity is multi-faceted. I am both a technical and whimsical maker. I am a spouse, mother, daughter, sister, and friend. I live my life with integrity, honesty, and love. I never intend to cause harm or discomfort to others, and if my actions offend you, please let me know so I can adjust my behavior.

Hate speech, racism, or bullying will not be tolerated on any of my platforms.

*****

**OTHER PLACES TO FIND ME:** 
My patterns on Payhip: https://payhip.com/shanalinesdesigns

For information on pattern releases including exclusive discounts, join my newsletter [HERE][1].

For more information about me, please visit my website: [www.shanalines.com][2]

Text, photos, and illustrations on all Shanalines Designs patterns © 2025, Shana S. Cohen. All rights reserved. Patterns are for personal use only. Please email with inquires about selling finished goods made from my patterns.


  [1]: https://www.shanalines.com/contact/
  [2]: www.shanalines.com

7340843.name: Rainbow Bead Fidget
7340843.notes_html:
Free version of this pattern is available on our website. The PDF pattern has a breakdown of each row / round and extra photos.

This free Rainbow Bead Fidget pattern combines your love of yarn with colourful glitter pony beads. Made with a handy lanyard clip, it’s perfect for on-the-go fidgeting. Easy to follow instructions make it beginner-friendly, and endless colour and bead combinations let you personalise your fidget. Get ready for some bead-rolling fun!

This crochet pattern is written for beginners and neurodiverse crafters. The abbreviated instructions are followed by a breakdown in italics making it easier to understand what you need to do in each row. If you’ve had trouble reading patterns in the past, we hope that you’ll give our patterns a try!

Materials
Worsted weight yarn (KnitPicks Brava)
- Cobblestone Heather
3.5mm crochet hook
Lanyard Clip
Pony Beads – 9mm (12 beads)
Scissors
Tapestry needle

users.about_me:
**Fox Creations** is a family-run crafty business based in Adelaide, South Australia. We love crafting and just about anything to do with yarn. Our mission is to help as many people as possible to access and enjoy the world of amigurumi and crochet. We’re committed to creating beginner-friendly patterns which have been developed in conjunction with neurodiverse crafters.

We are LGBTQIA+ friendly and believe in inclusivity and diversity within our community.

7417742.name: Beaded Fidget Kitty
7417742.notes_html:
This pattern is no sew and works up really quick! making it perfect for markets or fast gifts.

NO SEW PATTERN!

Crochet terms used in this pattern:
MC / Magic circle
SC / Single crochet
INC / Increase
DEC / Decrease
B / Put bead on hook
BLO / Back loop only
FLO / Front loop only
HDC / Half double crochet
DC / Double crochet
TR / Treble
BO / Bobble
F/O / Fasten off

I’d love to see how your Fidget Kittys turn out, don’t forget to tag NaughtyKnottsFromDee your finished photos!

COPYRIGHT
This pattern is intended for personal use only. All patterns, designs and photos included in this document are property of NaughtyKnottsFromDee.
Contents will not be sold, distributed or transferred to any other person. Handmade items produced from this pattern may be sold as long as credit for the design is given to NaughtyKnottsFromDee. Copyright 2025.

users.about_me:
Ahoy!!! Welcome to my shop where I sell crochet patterns :)

Here you will find adorable amigurumi designs that you will love making!

You can also find me on Instagram @NaughtyKnottsFromDee where I post what I've crocheted!

Your satisfaction as a customer is my top priority. If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions, please contact me and I will gladly assist you.

Hello everyone, my name is Destiny, the owner of NaughtyKnottsFromDee. I design crochet patterns. and I also share some free patterns on my Instagram and TikTok Notes. I'm 28 years old From Canada, and have a sweet doggy named Pandora. Also addicted to ice coffee LOL
